name: Apple-Oatmeal Muffins
author: Noor
summary: These muffins are great for a fast breakfast. I also put them in lunch boxes instead of cookies. They become even more moist the next day from the apples.
ingredients: ⅓ cup tightly packed brown sugar
1 ½ tablespoons butter, cut into small pieces
2 cups peeled and finely chopped apples
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line 18 muffin tin cups with cupcake papers
Mix brown sugar, all-purpose flour, and cinnamon together in a small bowl for crumb topping
Add butter and press with the back of a spoon or your fingers to incorporate it into the sugar mixture
Mix until crumbly and set aside
Toss apples with lemon juice in a large bowl
Mix in sugar, honey, buttermilk, oil, eggs, and vanilla until combined
Combine whole wheat flour, baking powder, cinnamon, baking soda, nutmeg, and salt in a smaller bowl
Gently fold flour mixture into the wet ingredients with a large spoon, until flour is just mixed in
Spoon batter into the prepared cupcake papers and sprinkle about 1 teaspoon crumb topping on top of each one
Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, 20 to 25 minutes
